pages.text: If you find yourself unable to get your hands on some seeds from exploring, you may have to resort to growing them yourself.

As you might know, the most common kind of wheat you find growing in the world are normal ones (you know, the stuff you bake bread from).$(br)These seeds can be converted into other seed types if you have the resources needed.

Suppose we want to get our hands on iron wheat seeds.$(br)You will need: $(li)One normal wheat seed $(li)One iron block $(li)One block of farmland to grow the wheat on $(br2)Once you have the above, you can begin the conversion process.

pages.title: Triticum Ferrus?
pages.text: Place the iron block down, a farmland on top, then plant your wheat.

After you're done, all you have to do is wait. Each time the normal wheat crop grows, there is a chance it'll convert to an iron wheat crop.$(br)Once that happens, you can harvest it and get iron wheat seeds!

pages.title: Triticum Ferrus!
pages.text: Patience will always pay off in the end.
